questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: The witness could not identify the suspect. His beard was gone and his hair was cut.
The witness could not identify the suspect whose beard was gone and hair was cut.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Everyone went to the concert last night.
Nobody did not go to the concert last night.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: As Joan entered the store, a man grabs her bag. She screamed and he ran away.
As Joan entered the store, a man grabbed her bag. She screamed and he ran away.

options.text: I couldnâ€™t hardly leave in the middle of the task.
I could hardly leave in the middle of the task.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: The woman saw a very short girl crossing the street.
The woman saw a girl crossing the street. She was very short.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: For days, the tenants reported the broken furnace as the cause of their discomfort.
The tenants reported the broken furnace for days as the cause of their discomfort.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Cheerful and alert, the boy awoke while the rest of the family continued to sleep.
Cheerful and alert, the rest of the family continued to sleep when the boy awoke.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Reporters have cited unidentified persons for days as the source of their story.
For days, reporters have cited unidentified persons as the source of their story.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Pass your sister the ticket from the boat.
Pass your sister from the boat the ticket.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Walking in the parking garage, the car horn honked. John covered his ears.
As John walked in the parking garage, he heard the car horn honk. He covered his ears.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Poverty, because of the falling high-school graduation rate, is increasing.
Poverty is increasing because of the falling high-school graduation rate.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Hardly anything matters anymore.
Hardly nothing matters anymore.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Yelling and screaming, the woman protested while the officer watched closely.
Yelling and screaming, the officer watched closely as the woman protested.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Driving down the street, loud noises came from the car.
Loud noises came from the car as it was driven down the street.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: She went to the store and the cafe to only buy candy and drink coffee.
She only went to the store to buy candy and to the cafe to drink coffee.
